definition: to confuse somebody completely; to be too difficult or strange for somebody to understand or explain
to cheat somebody, especially by taking money from them
to pull out hairs with your fingers or with tweezers
to pull the feathers off a dead bird, for example a chicken, in order to prepare it for cooking
to play a musical instrument, especially a guitar, by pulling the strings with your fingers
to remove somebody from a place or situation, especially one that is unpleasant or dangerous
to take hold of something and remove it by pulling it
to pick a fruit, flower, etc. from where it is growing
to say a name, number, etc. without thinking about it, especially in answer to a question
to make yourself do something even though you are afraid to do it
slowly, over a long period of time
separately, rather than as a group
immediately one after the other
to stick or attach something to something else; to be able to be fixed to something
not interested in politics; not thinking politics are important
not connected with a political party
very small pieces of stone or sand
the courage and strength of mind that makes it possible for somebody to continue doing something difficult or unpleasant

the effect created when two syllables in words that are close together have the same vowel sound, but different consonants, or the same consonants but different vowels, for example, sonnet and porridge or cold and killed
not original; used too often to be interesting or to sound sincere
that has been made very often before and is therefore not interesting
a type of mushroom that many people consider to be one of the best to eat
a strong ship designed to break a way through ice, for example in the Arctic or Antarctic
a thing that you do or say, such as a game or a joke, to make people feel more relaxed, especially at the beginning of a meeting, party, etc.
a yellow mushroom that grows in woods, has a hollow part in the centre and can be eaten
the unhappy feelings caused by knowing or thinking that you have done something wrong
the fact that somebody has done something illegal
blame or responsibility for doing something wrong or for something bad that has happened
things you say to somebody in order to make them feel guilty about something
a house or room that is not fit to live in because it is dirty or in very bad condition
a small building, usually made of wood or metal, that has not been built well
a wire that is stretched close to the ground as part of a device for catching somebody/something if they touch it
to kill somebody/something in a war or a fight
to murder somebody
to have a strong effect on somebody, especially to make them laugh
very cheap
a combination of words in a language that happens very often and more frequently than would happen by chance
the fact of two or more words often being used together, in a way that happens more frequently than would happen by chance
a type of Japanese or Chinese mushroom
a person's (usually a married man’s) mistress is a woman that they have a regular sexual relationship with and who is not their wife
a female teacher in a school, especially a private school
(in the past) the female head of a house, especially one who employed servants
the female owner of a dog or other animal
a woman who is in a position of authority or control, or who has a lot of skill in something
changing easily from one mood to another
likely to change suddenly; easily becoming dangerous
that changes easily into a gas
a very small fly with two wings that bites and often flies in large groups
before this time
a person or thing that has the same name as somebody/something else
in a way that is connected with language or the scientific study of language
in a way that is connected with the tongue
in a way that is connected with speech or language
related to the tongue
related to speech or language
produced using the tongue
the edge of a person’s hair, especially at the front
a very thin break or line
used to limit or make what you have just said less definite
a period of time during which a country, an organization, etc. does not have a leader and is waiting for a new one
in a way that is connected with the conditions of a legal written agreement, or that is agreed in a contract
to move forward on your hands and knees or with your body close to the ground
when an insect, a spider, etc. crawls, it moves forward on its legs
to move forward very slowly
to be too friendly or helpful to somebody in authority, in a way that is not sincere, especially in order to get an advantage from them
to search the internet in order to record and list data
if you say that somebody comes/crawls out of the woodwork, you mean that they have suddenly appeared in order to express an opinion or to take advantage of a situation
to make you feel afraid or full of horror
a man who plays a lot of sport, especially as a professional
a woman who plays a lot of sport, especially as a professional
